revised_title: Redescription of a Lower Carboniferous Anthracosaur Amphibian and the Status of Pholidogaster Pisciformis
tldr: The author describes a new genus and species of anthracosaur amphibian from the Lower Carboniferous of Scotland and rediscovers the status of Pholidogaster pisciformis Huxley. The anthracosaur's cranial anatomy is compared to other forms, suggesting a possible relationship to the American Mississippian anthracosaur Proterogyrinus. The author also rediscovers the holotype skull of Pholidogaster pisciformis and concludes that it is an early temnospondyl labyrinthodont, not closely related to anthracosaurs.
